newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary's H1 freight volume down yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Hungary's H1 freight volume down yr/yr.

text.p: The volume of Hungary's domestic freight transport -- a measure of the country's economic activity -- fell in the first half of 1996 compared to the same period last year, the Central Statistical Office (CSO) said on Tuesday.

"The weight of total deliveries in the first half (of 1996) was 17.3 percent less than in the corresponding period of 1995, while the performance measured in tonne-kilometres was 2.8 percent down," the CSO said in a statement.

Rail accounted for some 31 percent and road for some 41 percent of Hungary's total 69.57 million tonnes, or 11.24 billion tonne-kilometres of freight transportation in the first half of 1996, the CSO said.
